intro: Psychotria rakotonasoloi, commonly known as the Madagascar moonflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, night-blooming white flowers that emit a strong fragrance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
